items.text: excellent running from Bangladesh's openers. Das was back and across to get into line, and because the fielder is one the edge of the circle at mid off and the call is immediate, there's an easy single
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: comfortably nudged through square leg by Kayes, and they amble through once again.
items.postText: The fielders are doing their best to keep this ball dry.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: tight lines from Jarvis, and Das is happy to tap it back down the track.
items.postText: "It's going to be an important innings for both of these openers because Tamim is going to back in the next series," writes Chayon. "Soumya is also breathing on their necks by scoring runs in the parctice match and domestic games as well. Santo is also waiting in the dugout. Healthy competition to have."
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, no run

items.text: fetched! This wasn't even all that short from Jarvis, but Das goes deep in the crease to whip this pull firmly through square leg.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, FOUR runs

items.text: outside off this time, and Raza sprints to his right at extra cover to intercept the drive.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, no run

items.text: Das' bat has quite some middle to it. Again, Jarvis is short of a length rather than short, and Das is up on one leg to send the ball to wide long on with a short-arm jab.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, FOUR runs

items.preText: Kayes hasn't been quite as fluent as he was in the first ODI, and he's still searching for his first boundary. Chatara to continue.
items.text: Kayes is forward to slide one off the blade and through backward point for a single.
items.shortText: Chatara to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: punched firmly to point, but Mavuta gets down to it and palms the ball to cover.
items.shortText: Chatara to Liton Das, no run

items.text: was this a slower one? It looked like the offcutter from Chatara, but Das picks it and glances off the front foot through square leg.
items.shortText: Chatara to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: in the air, but past a diving Mavuta at backward point! Chatara floated the ball full and wide and Kayes through himself into a scorching drive. He didn't bother to keep it down, the ball evades the field and he finds the boundary.
items.shortText: Chatara to Imrul Kayes, FOUR runs

items.text: that's a much better line, on a length and honing in on off stump. Kayes defends
items.shortText: Chatara to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: once again Mavuta goes aerial as Kayes flays through point, this time to his right, but the ball beats him. Third man scoots round to keep them to a single.
items.shortText: Chatara to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: Kayes rises to meet a length delivery and punches to extra cover, but it's straight to the fielder, Sean Williams.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: fuller this time, and there's a one-two-three step shuffle down the track from Kayes after he leans forward to defend. He's looking for a single, but Das rightfully sends him back.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: off the face of the bat, and Kayes collects a single to third man.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: there's been precious little lateral movement through the air for him tonight, but Jarvis has managed to stick to a frugal line right at off stump, as he does now. Solid defence is the response
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, no run

items.text: Das steps forward to drive at a full one, but Jarvis bends low in his follow through to stun the ball
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, no run

items.text: Jarvis ends an excellent over with a slow offcutter, Das hopping back and across to nudge to cover.
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, no run

items.preText: Donald Tiripano replaces Chatara in the attack. He'll come round the wicket to start with. Expect plenty of changes of pace from him. Plenty of cutters.
items.text: just a hint of nip away from the left hander, and it's angled down behind square for one
items.shortText: Tiripano to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: Das is a little more forthright in his intentions as he chops down on this one, but third man keeps them to one.
items.shortText: Tiripano to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: using the pace cleverly! Tiripano bent his back on this one, but Kayes held his bat out and ran it off the edge and very fine down to third man. There's no slip in place, with the extra man in front of the wicket
items.shortText: Tiripano to Imrul Kayes, FOUR runs

items.text: a touch fuller from Tiripano, and it's tapped back towards him.
items.shortText: Tiripano to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: Kayes hasn't quite figured out how to time them on this wicket yet. Tiripano floated one full, and Kayes heaves at it, only for the ball to dribble mid on. He lost his shape again, and perhaps it didn't quite come on to him.
items.shortText: Tiripano to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: this is timed a little better! Too short from Tiripano, and without the pace to trouble him Kayes hammers a pull out into the deep. They've got protection at deep square, just the one.
items.shortText: Tiripano to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: more metronomic stuff from Jarvis. He angles a length delivery across Kayes' bows, and the batsman shoulders arms
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run
